messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] shaved legs
messages.msgSnippet: ... .................................................... He doesn t shave the third leg area, does he? In high school, my little brother, then a wrestler, said
messages.messageBody:
>
> > It takes him 15-20 minutes longer to shave his
> legs;
> > he's extra careful to get every one!
>
> How many legs does he have?
....................................................

He doesn't shave the third leg area, does he?

In high school, my little brother, then a wrestler,
said some of the boys would not bathe for a week or so
and would shave all of their body hair, then let it
during stink week, just before a match. this
supposedly would give them an advantage. No one wanted
to do any grasps or holds on such offensive persons.

Competitive swimmers shave body hair to reduce
friction.

Unrelated: Is it the Sufi who shave their body hair?

SOS

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] shaved legs
messages.msgSnippet: ... How many legs does he have?
messages.messageBody:
kbcdlovejo@... wrote:

> It takes him 15-20 minutes longer to shave his legs;
> he's extra careful to get every one!

How many legs does he have?

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] shaved legs
messages.msgSnippet: ... My husband and son do too. I don t mind the JUST shaved legs, but by the next day---they re awful! It takes him 15-20 minutes longer to shave his legs;
messages.messageBody:
> Now here's the rub, he shaved his LEGS!! Yep, right down to the smooth skin.
>
> YUCKO. I can't stand it. He did it to see what those "real"
> biker/triathlete
> types go through. He says it feels better because your bike tights don't
> pull
> on the hairs, I guess it's annoying.

My husband and son do too. I don't mind the JUST shaved legs, but by the next
day---they're awful! It takes him 15-20 minutes longer to shave his legs;
he's extra careful to get every one! He can spot a REAL biker by whether he
shaves his legs---the others are just "playing" at biking!

My boys don't shave for the hair-pulling, but for the gigantic strawberries
that they get mountain-biking! If there's no hair, it's not as goopy and
sticky while it's healing.

They don't fall as much now and have even slowed down in the winter months as
it's dark so early. I've noticed they're both letting the leg hair grow back
for January (Robert Burns' birthday is right around the corner---can't wear
the kilt with shaved legs---now, THAT'S YUCKO!).

Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
